scenario:
The S&P 500 is home to 500 companies from 11 different sectors, with the largest companies having a greater influence over its performance. The top five companies by market capitalization have a combined value of $14.9 trillion, representing 28.8% of the index. These companies are Apple, Nvidia, Microsoft, Alphabet, and Amazon, and they are forecast to spend hundreds of billions of dollars on artificial intelligence (AI) this year. 

Apple recently launched its Apple Intelligence software, which includes AI-powered writing tools and a Siri voice assistant upgrade. The company's latest chips, the A18 Pro, M3, and M4, were specifically designed for processing AI workloads on-device. Apple has over 2.2 billion devices worldwide, making it a potential major distributor of AI to consumers.

Nvidia is the leading supplier of graphics processors (GPUs) for developing AI, and its new Blackwell GB200 GPUs offer a substantial leap in performance. Demand for Blackwell chips is significantly outstripping supply, and Nvidia is on track to generate a record $128.6 billion in total revenue during fiscal 2025, followed by almost $200 billion in fiscal 2026.

Microsoft invested $10 billion in OpenAI and launched its own AI virtual assistant called Copilot, which is now embedded in its flagship software products. The company allocated $55.7 billion to capital expenditures during its fiscal 2024, most of which was related to AI data centers and chips. Microsoft is on track to invest a record amount in its AI ambitions during the current year.

Alphabet, the parent company of Google, launched its own family of AI models, called Gemini, to protect its dominance in the internet search business. The company is using AI to change how Google Search responds to queries, and its new AI Overviews feature incorporates text, images, and links to third-party websites to provide a more holistic answer to almost any question.

Amazon is integrating AI into the entire customer experience, offering a virtual shopping assistant called Rufus and using a tool called Project Private Investigator to identify defective products before they're shipped out. Amazon Web Services (AWS) generated $27.4 billion in total revenue during the third quarter of 2024, with AI revenue soaring by a triple-digit percentage. Amazon allocated around $75 billion to AI capital expenditures during 2024, and it's likely to spend even more in 2025 to cement its leadership position.
